```text
L1D_PEND_MISS.PENDING_CYCLES_ANY
MEM_INST_RETIRED.LOCK_LOADS

UNC_M_CAS_COUNT.WR
```

## PCM Command-Line Utility Usage Examples

```bash
# Basic usage: monitor system every 1 second
sudo ./pcm

# Monitor every 2 seconds
sudo ./pcm 2

# Monitor for 10 iterations at 1 second intervals
sudo ./pcm 1 -i=10

# Hide core output, show only socket and system summary
sudo ./pcm -nc

# Hide socket output
sudo ./pcm -ns

# CSV output to file
sudo ./pcm 1 -csv=output.csv -i=60

# Monitor specific process by PID
sudo ./pcm 1 -pid 12345

# Run as non-root (limited metrics, requires perf_event support)
echo -1 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_paranoid
export PCM_NO_MSR=1
export PCM_KEEP_NMI_WATCHDOG=1
./pcm
```

```bash
pcm-raw -?
```

## pcm-sensor-server Command-Line Utility Usage Examples

```bash
# Start HTTP server on default port 9738
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server

# Run on custom port
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server -p 8080

# Bind to specific IP address (localhost only)
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server -l 127.0.0.1 -p 9738

# Run in background (daemon mode, Linux/macOS)
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server -d

# Run with real-time priority (Linux only)
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server -R

# Debug mode with verbosity
sudo ./pcm-sensor-server -D 2

# As non-root with limited metrics
echo -1 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_paranoid
PCM_NO_MSR=1 PCM_KEEP_NMI_WATCHDOG=1 ./pcm-sensor-server
```

## Display pcm-sensor-server Help Information (Bash)

```bash
./pcm-sensor-server --help
```

## kmutil Commands for Debugging

```shell
$ kmutil log stream
$ kmutil inspect -b com.intel.driver.PcmMsr
```

## Monitor Accelerators with pcm-accel

```bash
# Monitor Intel accelerators (IAA, DSA, QAT)
sudo ./pcm-accel

# Monitor with 1-second intervals
sudo ./pcm-accel 1

# List available accelerators
sudo ./pcm-accel -l

# Monitor specific accelerator types
sudo ./pcm-accel -iaa  # Intel IAA only
sudo ./pcm-accel -dsa  # Intel DSA only
sudo ./pcm-accel -qat  # Intel QAT only
```

## Disabling System Integrity Protection (SIP)

```shell
reboot, command-option-R
csrutil disable
reboot again
```
